clinical_study.brief_title: Changes Induced by Early HABIT-ILE in Pre-school Children With Uni- and Bilateral Cerebral Palsy
clinical_study.official_title: Functional, Neuroplastic and Biomechanical Changes Induced by Early Hand and Arm Bimanual Intensive Therapy Including Lower Extremities (HABIT-ILE) in Pre-school Children With Uni- and Bilateral Cerebral Palsy

collaborator.agency: University Hospital of Brest, Pr. Sylvain Brochard (Co-PI)
University of Pisa, Pr. Andrea Guzetta
University Hospital of Angers, Pr Mickael Dinomais
University Hospital of Lausanne, Dr Christopher Newman
University of the Balearic Islands, Dr Inmaculada Riquelme

brief_summary.textblock: Studying in a two RCT the changes induced by early HABIT-ILE in functional, neuroplastic and biomechanical assessment in children with unilateral and bilateral CP.

detailed_description.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the effect of two weeks of early HABIT-ILE on bimanual performance in pre-school children with unilateral CP and on gross motor function in those with bilateral CP, compared with two weeks of usual motor activity including usual rehabilitation (control group). We will assess further changes in unilateral performance tests, daily life activities questionnaires and executive function tests. Neuroplastic changes will be assessed using brain imaging (magnetic resonance imaging, MRI) and biomechanical changes will be assessed by using optoelectronic motion capture system with EMG, to determine the effect of HABIT-ILE on movement pattern and quality.

primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-camp, two weeks post-camp, 3 months follow-up.
primary_outcome.description: Developed to assess the changes in gross motor function of children with cerebral palsy (scored in percentage), observed over time or after intervention for the RCT2

primary_outcome.measure: Change on Manual Ability (Assisting Hand Assessment (AHA))
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-camp, two weeks post-camp, 3 months follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Developed to observe the efficacy of the assisting hand use, in children with unilateral cerebral palsy (scored in percentage), during bimanual activities for the RCT1

secondary_outcome.measure: Melbourne 2 Assessment (MA2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-camp, two weeks post-camp, 3 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: assess the unilateral performance of the upper extremities, quantifying the dexterity, fluency, accuracy and range of movement during several tasks of reaching and manipulation

secondary_outcome.measure: Inhibitory control task
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-camp, two weeks post-camp, 3 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Measures the inhibition of a motor answer. It's assessed by asking the child not to reach for a toy previously showed to play with. The maximum waiting time is 30 seconds.

secondary_outcome.measure: Working memory task
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-camp, two weeks post-camp, 3 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Measures the capacity to retain visual information in use, in a short period of time. It's assessed by hiding a toy in front of the child and asking him/her to find it from 4 possibilities.

secondary_outcome.measure: Visuo-spatial attention assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-camp, two weeks post-camp, 3 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Through different simple tasks, measures the visual field, the visuo-motor coordination, the orientation of attention in the space and the eye pursuit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Semmes-Weinstein monofilaments
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-camp, two weeks post-camp, 3 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluates the pressure threshold or the response to a touching sensation of the filament. It is quantified using a numerical grading ranging from high pression/clear touching sensation to a slight pression/slight touching sensation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pressure Threshold
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-camp, two weeks post-camp, 3 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: The superior pressure threshold will be determined at the moment of any visible change in the child's reaction to the pression made by the algometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACTIVLIM-CP questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-camp, two weeks post-camp, 3 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Measures performance of the child in daily life activities focusing on upper and lower extremities.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pediatric Evaluation of Disability Inventory questionnaire (PEDI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-camp, two weeks post-camp, 3 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Measures the performance of the child in the daily life activities and movement domains, focusing on the capacity of upper extremities and lower extremities during this activities.

secondary_outcome.measure: Young children's participation and environment measure (YC-PEM)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-camp, two weeks post-camp, 3 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Based in different children's activities, this questionnaire evaluates the level of participation and the quality of the environment in which these activities take place.

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure of Processes of Care (MPOC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-camp, two weeks post-camp, 3 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Assesses the parents' perceptions of the care they and their children receive from children's rehabilitation treatment centres.

secondary_outcome.measure: Canadian Occupational Performance Measure (COPM)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-camp, two weeks post-camp, 3 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: This is an interview-setting designed to capture a patient's self-perception of performance and satisfaction of it in everyday activities, observed over time.

secondary_outcome.measure: 3D T1-weighted structural imaging (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: This sequence allows to measure changes in gray matter (cortical thickness)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes on the Fractional Anisotropy (Diffusion tensor imaging (DTI))
secondary_outcome.description: This sequence allows to measure changes in the fractional anisotropy (FA) on the white matter tracts. FA is a scalar value (no unit) between zero and one that describes the degree of anisotropy of white matter water molecules.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes on the Mean Diffusivity (Diffusion tensor imaging (DTI))
secondary_outcome.description: This sequence allows to measure the mean changes in the diffusivity (MD). MD is a scalar value (no unit) between zero and one that describes the degree of molecular diffusion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional resting state (RS)
secondary_outcome.description: This sequence allows to evaluates the regional interactions that occur in a resting or task-negative state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes on spatial parameters of the gait (Kinematics assessments)
secondary_outcome.description: Through a 3D motion system, we measure the stride length (meters), step length (meters) and step width (meters).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes on temporal parameters of the gait (Cycle time)
secondary_outcome.description: Through a 3D motion system, we measure cycle of gait time (seconds).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes on temporal parameters of the gait (Stance time)
secondary_outcome.description: Through a 3D motion system, we measure the stance time (percentage of total gait cycle).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes on temporal parameters of the gait (Swing time)
secondary_outcome.description: Through a 3D motion system, we measure the swing time (percentage of total gait cycle).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes on temporal parameters of the gait (Stride)
secondary_outcome.description: Through a 3D motion system, we measure the gait cadence (stride per minute).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes on temporal parameters of the gait (Velocity)
secondary_outcome.description: Through a 3D motion system, we measure the gait velocity (meter/second)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes on temporal parameters of the gait (Acceleration)
secondary_outcome.description: Through a 3D motion system, we measure the gait acceleration (meters/second^2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes on spatial parameters of the upper extremity (Straightness)
secondary_outcome.description: Through a 3D motion system, we measure the straightness (percentage of upper extremity trajectory during a reaching task).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes on spatial parameters of the upper extremity (Smoothness)
secondary_outcome.description: Through a 3D motion system, we measure the smoothness (variability of the movement during a reaching task)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes on temporal parameters of the upper extremity (Kinematics assessments)
secondary_outcome.description: Through a 3D motion system, we measure the time from onset to end of the task (seconds). the task consist in a reaching task.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantification of physical activity
secondary_outcome.description: With a movement sensor on each wrist, the percentage of total time spent in movement (i.e. crawling, walking and running) is measured. Calculated in terms of the changes in the acceleration (m/s^2). These measurements will be performed during therapy in 5 consecutive days for the HABIT-ILE group and during a regular week for the Usual Care group.

arm_group.description: Early HABIT-ILE (Hand and arm bimanual intensive therapy including lower extremities) will be applied over 2 weeks.
A two weeks period of usual customary care

intervention.description: Early Hand and arm bimanual intensive therapy including lower extremities

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- children with unilateral or bilateral cerebral palsy (spastic or dyskinetic)
- age 1 to 4 years inclusive (corrected age if preterm birth)
- ability to follow instructions and complete testing according to the age.
Exclusion Criteria:
- active seizure
- programmed botulinum toxin or orthopedic surgery in the 6 months previous to the intervention, during intervention period or 3months after the intervention time
- severe visual impairments
- severe cognitive impairments
- contraindications to perform MRI assessments (Metal implants, etc.)
